name: American Black Bear
description: Excellent tree climbers, often found in forests.

name: Grizzly Bear
description: Identifiable by the distinct hump on their shoulders.

name: Moose
description: The largest member of the deer family.

name: White-tailed Deer
description: Raises its tail to show a white 'flag' when alarmed.

name: American Bison
description: The national mammal of the United States.

name: Mountain Lion
description: Also known as cougar, puma, or panther.

name: Coyote
description: Highly adaptable and can be found in every US state except Hawaii.

name: Bobcat
description: Named for their short, 'bobbed' tail.

name: Gray Wolf
description: The largest member of the dog family and a social animal that lives in packs.

name: Raccoon
description: Known for its dexterity and 'masked' face.

name: North American Beaver
description: Their dams create wetlands that support thousands of other species.

name: Striped Skunk
description: Can spray its defensive musk up to 10 feet.

name: Virginia Opossum
description: The only marsupial (pouched mammal) found north of Mexico.

name: Eastern Gray Squirrel
description: Plays a crucial role in forest regeneration by burying nuts.

name: Red Fox
description: The largest of the true foxes and highly adaptable to urban environments.
origin: North America, Europe, Asia, North Africa

name: Bald Eagle
description: Builds the largest nest of any North American bird.

name: Red-tailed Hawk
description: Known for its rasping scream, often used in movies as a generic eagle sound.

name: Great Blue Heron
description: Hunts by standing motionless in shallow water waiting for fish.

name: Wild Turkey
description: Benjamin Franklin famously preferred this bird over the Bald Eagle.

name: Canada Goose
description: Famous for their V-shaped flying formation.

name: American Alligator
description: Have been around for about 37 million years.

name: Eastern Box Turtle
description: Can live for over 100 years in the wild.

name: American Crocodile
description: Unlike the alligator's U-shaped snout, crocodiles have a V-shaped snout and visible lower teeth.
origin: North America, South America, Central America

name: Burmese Python
description: Massive constrictors decimating mammals in the Florida Everglades.

name: Green Iguana
description: Cause damage to infrastructure by digging burrows; thrive in Florida.

name: Argentine Black and White Tegu
description: Large lizard that eats the eggs of native birds and reptiles.

name: Cane Toad
description: Toxic amphibian that kills pets and native predators who try to eat it.

name: European Starling
description: Introduced to NY in 1890; huge flocks damage crops and airplanes.

name: House Sparrow
description: Aggressively competes with native birds for nesting cavities.

name: Rock Pigeon
description: The common city pigeon; carries diseases and damages buildings.

name: Monk Parakeet
description: Builds massive communal nests on power lines, causing outages.

name: Wild Boar
description: Highly destructive to crops and native habitats due to rooting behavior.

name: Nutria
description: Large rodent that destroys wetlands; looks like a beaver with a rat tail.

name: Elk
description: One of the largest species within the deer family, known for massive antlers.

name: Pronghorn
description: The fastest land mammal in the Western Hemisphere.

name: Northern Cardinal
description: Males are brilliant red; they don't migrate and brighten up winter landscapes.

name: American Bullfrog
description: The largest frog in North America, with a distinctive deep call.

name: Gila Monster
description: One of the few venomous lizards in the world, found in the Southwest.

name: Nine-banded Armadillo
description: Known for its armor-like shell and tendency to jump when startled.

name: Bighorn Sheep
description: Known for their massive curved horns and ability to climb steep cliffs.

name: North American River Otter
description: Playful semi-aquatic mammals with thick, water-repellent fur.

name: Polar Bear
description: The largest land carnivore, perfectly adapted for life on Arctic sea ice.

name: Arctic Fox
description: Changes coat color from brown in summer to white in winter for camouflage.

name: Caribou
description: Known as Reindeer globally; both males and females grow antlers.

name: Dall Sheep
description: White sheep found in mountain ranges of Alaska and northwest Canada.

name: Muskox
description: Large, shaggy mammal adapted to the frigid Arctic tundra.

name: Wolverine
description: A powerful and aggressive scavenger, resembling a small bear but actually a weasel.

name: Spotted Salamander
description: Large black salamander with distinct yellow or orange spots.

name: Red-spotted Newt
description: Has a bright orange terrestrial stage known as the 'red eft'.

name: Eastern Hellbender
description: The largest aquatic salamander in the US, nicknamed 'snot otter'.

name: Snowy Owl
description: Large, white owl of the high Arctic, made famous by Harry Potter.

name: Peregrine Falcon
description: The fastest animal on the planet, reaching speeds over 200 mph in a dive.

name: Barn Owl
description: Distinctive heart-shaped face and pale plumage, found worldwide.

name: Ring-necked Pheasant
description: Popular game bird with colorful plumage, introduced from Asia.

name: Mute Swan
description: Large white swan with an orange beak; aggressively defends territory.

name: Brown Anole
description: Highly invasive lizard that displaces the native Green Anole.

name: Nile Monitor
description: Large carnivorous lizard established in Florida, preying on native wildlife.

name: Axis Deer
description: Originally from India, now invasive in Texas and Hawaii; spots persist into adulthood.

name: Blue Jay
description: Noisy and intelligent bird with bright blue plumage.

name: Harbor Seal
description: True seal (no ear flaps); often seen resting on rocks.

name: California Sea Lion
description: Eared seal known for its intelligence and barking vocalization.

name: Walrus
description: Massive Arctic marine mammal recognizable by prominent tusks.

name: Northern Elephant Seal
description: Huge seal with a distinctive trunk-like proboscis in males.

name: Great Horned Owl
description: Large owl with distinctive ear tufts.

name: Veiled Chameleon
description: Invasive in Florida; distinguishable by the towering casque on its head.

name: Tokay Gecko
description: Large, aggressive gecko with blue skin and orange spots.

name: Eastern Chipmunk
description: Small ground squirrel with distinct stripes along its back.

name: Osprey
description: The 'Fish Hawk', unique for diving feet-first into water.

name: Brown Pelican
description: Large water bird known for its massive throat pouch.

name: Western Diamondback Rattlesnake
description: Venomous pit viper with a distinctive rattle at the end of its tail.

name: Common Garter Snake
description: The most widely distributed snake in North America.

name: Eastern Copperhead
description: Venomous snake with a distinct hourglass pattern.

name: Domestic Cat
description: Common house cat; feral populations decimate local birdlife.

name: Domestic Dog
description: Man's best friend; breeds vary wildly in appearance.

name: Common Snapping Turtle
description: Large freshwater turtle with a prehistoric look and powerful bite.

name: Painted Turtle
description: The most widespread native turtle of North America.

name: Eastern Cottontail
description: The most common rabbit in North America, with a cotton-ball tail.

name: American Mink
description: Semi-aquatic carnivore with rich dark fur.

name: Black-tailed Prairie Dog
description: Keystone species of the Great Plains; lives in vast underground towns.

name: North American Porcupine
description: Protected by sharp quills; slow-moving and climbs trees.

name: Jaguar
description: Largest cat in the Americas; rare individuals cross into Arizona.

name: Eastern Fox Squirrel
description: Largest tree squirrel in North America, with orange-tinged fur.

name: American Red Squirrel
description: Small, territorial squirrel known for its loud, chattering call.

name: Groundhog
description: Also known as Woodchuck; lowland cousin of the marmot.

name: Yellow-bellied Marmot
description: The 'Rock Chuck' of western mountains.

name: Desert Tortoise
description: Slow-moving reptile adapted to life in the Mojave and Sonoran deserts.

name: Rhesus Macaque
description: Established feral populations exist in Florida (Silver Springs).

name: American Badger
description: Fierce fossorial carnivore with a distinctive facial stripe.

name: American Marten
description: Tree-dwelling weasel found in northern forests.

name: Ocelot
description: Small wild cat with beautiful chain-like rosettes.

name: Gemsbok
description: Distinctive antelope with long straight horns; introduced to White Sands, NM.

name: Gray Fox
description: The only American canid that can climb trees.

name: Black-footed Ferret
description: One of the most endangered mammals in North America.

name: Sea Otter
description: Keystone marine mammal; keeps urchin populations in check.

name: American Flamingo
description: Iconic pink bird found in shallow lagoons and mudflats.

name: Green Anole
description: The only anole native to the US; changes color from green to brown.

name: Whooping Crane
description: Tallest bird in North America; famous conservation success story.

name: Mountain Goat
description: Sure-footed climber found in high alpine environments.

name: Snowshoe Hare
description: Changes color from brown in summer to white in winter.

name: Mallard
description: The most familiar duck; male has a glossy green head.
